item.title: Are you / I am / It’s
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Student A: _____ new here? Student B: Yes, _____. _____ my first day in this school. Student A: Oh, nice! Welcome to class 31.

item.title: Are you from here? / Where are you from?
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Teacher: I’m Mr. Bates. Welcome to class 31. Student: Thank you Mr. Bates. Teacher: _____________________ Student: No, I am not. Teacher: _____________________ Student: Mexico City.
Where are you from? / What is your address?
Do you live here? / Where do you live?
Are you from here? / Where are you from?

item.title: What is your name? / What is your last name?
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Teacher: ____________________ Student: Carlos. Teacher: ____________________ Student: Hernández.
What is your name? / What is your last name?
What is your full name? / What is your family name?
What is your last name / What is your surname?

item.title: Are you / I’m not / is
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Student A: _____ from Perú? Student B: No, _____. I’m from Mexico. Student A: Oh really? My mother _____ from Mexico too.

item.title: She is a nurse.
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Student A: What does your mother do? Student B: _____________________

item.title: my / Mine
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Student A: Is this book yours? Student B: Let me see. No, this is not _____ book. _____ has a plastic cover.

item.title: I like to read and play the guitar.
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Teacher: What do you like to do in your free time, Carlos? Carlos: _______________________
I like to read and play the guitar.
I do like play the guitar.
I do read in my free time.

item.title: her / she
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Student A: Do you know Tina? Student B: No, I don’t know _____. Is _____ the one standing next to the door?

item.title: When do you have English class?
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Student A: _____________________ Student B: On Tuesdays and Thursdays.
What time is your English class?
When do you have English class?

item.title: I am a teacher.
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Carlos: What do you do for a living? Tina: ________________

item.title: Do you / I do
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Carlos: _____ work on Fridays? Tina: Yes, _____.

item.title: Does / he does
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Student A: _____ Mr. Bates have a wife? Student B: Yes, _____.

item.title: He is my sister’s boyfriend.
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Student A: Are they new students? Student B: No, they aren’t. She is my sister and _____________________.
he the boyfriend of my sister

item.title: How much is / It’s
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Student A: __________ the English book? Student B: _____ U$ 39,99.

item.title: Who / black boots
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Student A: _____ is Mr. Bates? Student B: He is the one with ________.

item.title: I play soccer twice a week.
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Student A: How often do you play soccer? Student B: __________________
I play soccer with my friends.
I play soccer twice a week.
I play soccer often a week.

item.title: I am 23 / on July 30th
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Teacher: Let’s try to exchange basic information about us. Please say your name, age and birthday. Tina, you can start. Tina: My name is Tina, ___________ and my birthday is _______________.
I have 23 years old / at July 30th

item.title: speak / she can / she speaks
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Student A: Can she ________ English well? Student B: Yes, ________. She lived in California for 5 years. ____________ English better than me.

item.title: finishes / a quarter to four
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Student A: I’m tired. Is the class almost finished? Student B: It ___________ in 15 minutes. Student A: Oh really? What time is it? Student B: It’s ____________________.
finish / a quarter to four o’clock

item.title: him / his / his
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Teacher: Does somebody know why Steve didn’t come today? Can somebody call _____? Student: I don’t have _____ phone. But I can stop by _____ house.

item.title: was / were / was
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Student A: This morning I was so tired that I didn’t realize that I _____ in the wrong class. Student B: Oh really? Where _____ you last night? Student A: I _____ at home studying for my Math test late night.

item.title: Did you call / I did / didn’t see
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Student A: __________ me last night? Student B: Yes, ________. Sorry for calling so late. Student A: It’s ok. I went to bed at 10 p.m. and __________ when you called me.
Do you called / I called / not saw
Did you called / I did call / didn’t saw
Did you call / I did / didn’t see

item.title: What did you do / my parents’ house
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Student A: _____________ last weekend? Student B: I went to __________________________.
What did you do / my parents’ house
What do you do / the house of my parents
What do you did / my parents’s house

item.title: Do you like / I don’t eat
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Student A: __________ vegetables? Student B: I do, but honestly __________ vegetables very often.
You like of / I don’t like
Do you like / I don’t eat
Are you like / I don’t like eat

item.title: I went / Where do they live?
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Student A: Where did you go last December? Student B: ___________ to my family’s house. Student A: _______________________? Student B: Washington D.C.
I go / Where are you from?
I went / Where do they live?
I had gone / What is their address?

item.title: Is there any other restaurante or food store around?
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Michael: I looked around but the snack store is closed. Rachel: Really? ________________________________________? I’m hungry. Michael: I will take a look around.
Have another restaurant or food store around?
Is there any other restaurante or food store around?
Has it other restaurant or food store around?

item.title: asked / said
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Michael: What is the boarding time, darling? Rachel: I ________ the attendant and she ________ 6 a.m. Michael: I am so hungry. I can’t wait to get to the airplane.

item.title: did you get / gave / found
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Rachel: Honey, ________ the passport from my purse? Michael: No, I didn’t. I _____ it back to you. Rachel: Oh, don’t worry. I just _____ it!

item.title: Is there a place where I can charge my phone?
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Rachel: ______________________________? Michael: Yes, I think I saw an outlet next to the snack store.
Have a place for me to charge my phone?
Does it has a place to charge my phone?
Is there a place where I can charge my phone?

item.title: She has short blond hair and green eyes.
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Michael: Excuse me, can you please give this headphone to my wife? She is sitting at the front row. Flight attendant: Sure, no problem! What does she look like? Michael: ____________________________
She has short blond hair and green eyes.
She is a teacher. She likes reading.

item.title: I would like to have / Which one is Vincent?
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Michael: Can I change my meal before boarding? _____________________ a vegetarian meal. Attendant: No problem. Please talk to Vincent at the AA information desk. Michael: _________________________? Attendant: He is the one wearing a blue shirt.
I would like to have / Which one is Vincent?
I want to have / How is Vincent?
I like to have / What is Vincent?

item.title: What are you doing?
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Rachel: ___________________? Michael: I am trying to find the button to call the flight attendant. I need some water to take my medicine.

item.title: Yes, I did. / What are you watching?
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Michael: Did you find anything interesting to watch? Rachel: __________. There are some good movies. Michael: __________________________? Rachel: “Pride and Prejudice”.
Yes, I find. / What do you like?
Yes, I do. / What is the movie?
Yes, I did. / What are you watching?

item.title: How much do you need? / Not much
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Rachel: Michel, do you have some money? I want to buy a juice. Michael: __________________? Rachel: __________ … maybe US $5.
How much do you need? / Not much
How many do you need? / Not many
How many money do you need? / Not any

item.title: How was / How much food did you get?
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Rachel: ________ your dinner, honey? Michael: It was O.K., but the food was not enough… Rachael: _____________________? Michael: A small portion of brown rice and and very little vegetables…
How was / How much food did you get?
Do you like / What did you like about the food?
What is / Do you like your food?

item.title: we are going to do / We are going to go to
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Rachel: What is the first thing __________ in New York? Michael: __________ the hotel and rest. Later we see which places to go.
do we will do / We will do go to
we going to / We gonna go to
we are going to do / We are going to go to

item.title: there are several museums in New York / is bigger than
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Rachel: Michael, __________________________… Which one is the biggest? Michael: I don’t know… I believe the Metropolitan __________ the Museum of Natural History, but I am not sure which one is the biggest.
there are several museums in New York / is bigger than
New York has several museums / is biggest than
have several museums in New York / is the biggest

item.title: Is there any / There is always
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Michael: Are you going to go to the bathroom? Rachel: I was planning to. __________ bathroom around here? Michael: __________ a bathroom at the baggage claim area.
Does it has a / It always has
Is there any / There is always

item.title: Which places do you want to visit in New York?
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Michael: _______________________________________? Rachel: I would like to go to a big book store! You know I love reading! Michael: And let’s also go to the Apple store. You know I love computers.
Which places do you want to visit in New York?
Where you want visit in New York?
What would you like to do visit in New York?

item.title: Which one? / The most famous one.
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Michael: What is the name of that famous building in New York? Rachel: __________? The Rockefeller Center? Michael: No, not that one. ____________________. Rachel: Oh, I know. It’s the Empire State Building!
What building? / The more famous one.
Which one? / The most famous one.

item.title: How can I help you? / I would like to
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Attendant: Good morning, sir. ________________? Michael: ________________ change my meal. Attendant: What kind of meal do you want? Michael: I would like to have a vegetarian meal. Oh, and for my wife too.
What do you need? / I'm needing to
Can I help you? / I want
How can I help you? / I would like to

item.title: Have you been to the U.S. before?
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Agent: What are you here for? Business or pleasure? Michael: Pleasure. Agent: ___________________________? Michael: No, it’s our first time.
Do you know the U.S. already?
Have you been to the U.S. before?
Did you come to the U.S. before?

item.title: I’d like apple juice with ice, please.
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Flight attendant: Would you like something to drink, sir? Michael: What do you have? Flight attendant: We have Coke, Sprite, apple or tomato juice, sparkling and still water. Michael:_________________________________________.
I’d like apple juice with ice, please.
I like have apple juice with ice, please.
I want drink apple juice with ice, please.

item.title: Michael, can you help me with my seat belt? / We should call the flight attendant.
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Rachel: __________________________? It is not working… Michael: Wait a minute. I think it is broken. _________________________.
Michael, you help me with my seat belt? / We may call the flight attendant.
Michael, can you help me with my seat belt? / We should call the flight attendant.
Michael, could you help me with my seat belt? / We do call the flight attendant.

item.title: I have never seen snow before!
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Rachel: This is so nice! I always wanted to come to New York! Michael: I know! This is really great! ____________________! Rachel: This is so exciting!
I have never snow in my life!
I never had see snow in my life!
I have never seen snow before!

item.title: my sister did / I grew up
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: James: So, Rachel, did you and your sister grow up in Canada? Rachel: Actually, _________. __________ in the U.S. with my father. My parents are divorced. James: Interesting. I didn’t know that!
my sister were / I grew up
my sister did / I grew up

item.title: I used to be / didn’t
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: James: It’s funny, I know you and my sister were really good friends, but I don’t remember seeing you around very often. Rachel: Well, I was a very shy kid. I __________ very quiet and people __________ really realize that I was around... James: Oh, that’s why!

item.title: I’m not / My sister was
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Rachel: It’s so good to see you James! I haven’t seen you in ages. James: I thought you were living in Finland. Rachel: No, _________. _______________, but she is now back to Canada.

item.title: Do you know where her house is?
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Rachel: I don’t remember my first grade teacher’s name, but I remember she was a very nice person! James: I remember her! Sandra. That’s her name! She leaves nearby the school. Rachel: _____________________________? I would like to visit her.
Do you know where are her house?
Do you know where her house is?
Where do you know is her house?

item.title: we have less time now than
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: James: Sometimes I think those days were better... Rachel: Well, maybe. I would say ________________________ in the past, but we also have more opportunities in life, don’t you think?
we have less time now than

item.title: not big enough / really difficult
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: James: So why did you leave San Francisco? Rachel: Well, you know, my family grew quite a lot. With three kids the house was _____________ and life got ______________ in the big city with a large family.

item.title: have you been to / we have been
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Rachel: I see that you and your family travel a lot. How many countries _________________? James: I actually never really counted. But I believe _____________ to 20 or 25 countries so far.
have you been to / we have been
did you go / we did go

item.title: Have you ever tried Thai food? / Yes, I have.
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Rachel: I love traveling I wish I could travel as often as you do. James: I love traveling and trying the new food we find in each place. Rachel: Me too! ________________________________? James: __________. Thai food is great!
Did you try Thai food? / Yes, I ate.
Have you ever tried Thai food? / Yes, I have.
Do you try Thai food? / Yes, I do.

item.title: shuttle / round-trip
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Rachel: So, I believe you spend a lot of time in planes and airports, right? James: I, do. But actually I don’t like airports. Specially the big ones that you have to get a __________ bus to go from one terminal to the other. Rachel: I know! I rather go by train. Sometimes I don’t even buy __________ tickets so I am flexible to stay longer or leave earlier.

item.title: I am eating out
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: James: What are your plans while you are staying here? Rachel: I’m thinking of visiting some friends and family. By the way, ______________ tonight with my brother, do you and your family want to come along? James: Sounds great to me!

item.title: we will be / I am working
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: James: Sorry Rachel, I forgot what time do we go to the restaurant tonight. Rachel: No problem! I told my brother ____________ there at 7 p.m. James: Perfect! ____________ until 6 p.m. and then I go straight to the restaurant.
we will / I will to work
we will be / I am working
we will go / I was working

item.title: Could you, please, bring my jacket along with you?
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Rachel: Hi James, it’s me, Rachel. We are at the restaurant already and I just realized I forgot my jacket. Are you going to stop by your house on the way here? James: I can stop there if you need. Rachel: ______________________________________?
Could you, please, bring my jacket along with you?
Can you get my jacket with you, please?
Please, would you mind my jacket when you come?

item.title: would like to / haven’t talked
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Rachel: I really ____________ talk to your sister. We ____________ for a long time! James: We can call her if you want. Maybe she can come here for dinner one of these days. Rachel: That will be perfect!

item.title: summer / winter
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: James: Are you enjoying your time here, Rachel? Rachel: Yes, I am. I’m so happy I came during ____________ this time. The weather is so much better now. I know for you is a little too hot, but for me it’s better than the cold days during ___________. James: I know. It was really cold last time you came here.

item.title: How do I get to the restaurant?
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Rachel: _________________________________? James: Go to the main avenue, turn right on Oliver street, turn left after three blocks and then turn right again. It’s quite easy to find the place.
Where do I go to the restaurant?
What is the address for the restaurant?
How do I get to the restaurant?
